column4: hmmm, i installed the cup ubuntu package, which is a program that should also install some java libs - the program runs fine, but when i try to compile the example code it generates, my java compiler complains about the libraries missing.. what do i do now? how do i find out if the libs got indeed installed?
what did the log say?
what log?
what did the log say was missing?
the error exactly,
typical java package missing error : parser.java:294: package java_cup.runtime does not exist
there ya go.   I bet there were more errors rehf,
and all the usual following errors. i'm wondering, shouldn't the package have installed those libraries into the system java?
http://www.google.com/search?hl=en&rls=org.mozilla%3Aen-US%3Aofficial&q=package+java_cup.runtime+does+not+exist&btnG=Search
http://pastebin.com/da800dbf
I bet there's a WORSE err0r
search the worse eRRoR
was that directed at me? did you ever compile java?
CVS?
what? :( there's actually other erros in the main class, but the package won't magically appear when i fix those
I always try to grep the WORST err0r and then fix that.
just the way I do shit
so, do you have any idea regarding the package / libraries issue?
yeah there could be errors.
one error bringing the whole thing down
use intuition
I gotta get outta this channel before they ban me for typing words.  (morals and religon be damned) words - look up Frank Zappa on Archive.org
peace!  and relax your emergency isn't mine
lol. do you actually write what i say? did you EVER compile java? your comments only waste more of my time, it seems
